repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body:
Looks like this is a clobbered remnant of code that used to live in `did_set_string_option` [here](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/ff5cfcdeab2446459ab59d44ce173ef811902c49/src/nvim/optionstr.c#L1550-L1575); the comparison should be against `&curbuf->b_p_ft` anyway at that callsite.

But if the old buffer was freed by autocmds, wouldn't using `varp` in a comparison be illegal anyway? :thinking:

This issue bit me recently. `nvim_get_option_value` sometimes gave incorrect defaults from `LspAttach` when it indirectly ran from `FileType`...

Maybe some level of recursion can be allowed later, but for now the error is better than silence.
After a bit of tinkering, I feel like it's _maybe_ better to just allow it and let the `apply_autocmds_group` nesting check take the wheel. :innocent:

Dunno if it's too heavy-handed to bother closing windows, but it's similar to the static [`wipe_dummy_buffer()` in quickfix.c](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/dddc359213be522026d60ffd89867a0f52f19256/src/nvim/quickfix.c#L6012). Not sure why that one isn't using `close_windows`, though.

comment_regular_data.body: I think this is fine. I'll merge to fix the crashes, but move the last commit that changes the FileType autocmd handling to another PR for review. #37414

repo.description: [Contribution Fork] Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(api): various nvim_get_option_value dummy buffer issues
